definition: amiable and approachable (idiom); easy-going/modest and unassuming/(of writing) plain and simple/easy to understand
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes

sentences.english: “Anna is just a very easy person to get to know, that’s why she had a lot of friends, ” Mr. Guirguis said.
sentences.chinese: 安娜非常平易近人，純真善良，所以她有許多朋友。

sentences.english: You might say that Michael is clothed in "approachability."
sentences.chinese: 你可以說，麥可的服裝讓他平易近人。

sentences.english: Elegant and supple tannins on the palate give the wine gentle structure with approachability.
sentences.chinese: 優雅，溫和，飽滿的丹寧使得該酒平易近人。

sentences.english: She was a successful advertising executive, highly intelligent yet easygoing.
sentences.chinese: 她是個成功的廣告主管，非常聰明但又平易近人。

sentences.english: They speak to me. I come across as approachable.
sentences.chinese: 他們和我講話，我顯得平易近人。

sentences.english: It makes the company-person and the corporation more approachable.
sentences.chinese: 企業博客使得企業形象與企業本身都更加平易近人。

sentences.english: Chen's public persona is *approachable, and he frequently interacts with fans.
sentences.chinese: 陳鴻宇的公衆形象十分平易近人，經常和粉絲互動。

sentences.english: For one, the people out here are a lot,  they're more nice and more approachable.
sentences.chinese: 第一，這裏的人們很友好，很平易近人。

sentences.english: A lot of professors here are pretty down to earth, I think.
sentences.chinese: 這裏的很多教授都很平易近人，我覺得。

sentences.english: To her, I'm an easy-going, dim-witted foreigner.
sentences.chinese: 對她來說，我很平易近人，是個有點傻氣的外國人。

sentences.english: Pendennis is one of the most affable young men I ever knew.
sentences.chinese: 潘登尼斯是我認識的最平易近人的年輕人之一。

sentences.english: Good, amiable, good-natured, open to afford a joke.
sentences.chinese: 善良，平易近人，脾氣好，開得起玩笑。

sentences.english: Even after becoming a minister, he still keeps his common touch with people.
sentences.chinese: 他當了部長以後，仍未失去平易近人的作風。

sentences.english: The more I got along with Mr. President, the more I found him humorous and approachable.
sentences.chinese: 越和總統先生相處，我就越發現他善談而平易近人。

sentences.english: A good way to become more approachable isby joining a volunteer organization.
sentences.chinese: 要想變得更加平易近人，最好是參加一些志願活動。

definition: cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
amiable (manner)/unassuming/written in plain language/easy to take in
way of doing sth/behavior/to act in an affected manner/mannerism/gestures in opera
